AdditionalFields.Value: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science,Data Science

Description: Recent advances in spatial technologies are transforming our understanding of genes and proteins in tissues, enabling detailed analysis at both cellular and subcellular levels. These breakthroughs yield profound insights from patient samples, such as tumor biopsies, which are instrumental in the selection of cancer treatments and the comprehension of treatment responses. However, the vast and complex datasets produced by spatial experiments call for sophisticated computational tools to effectively interpret the spatial distribution and function of cells within tissues. This session aims to address the computational hurdles in spatial biology and will highlight how machine learning algorithms are being applied to decode tissue structure and cellular organization, specifically within the realm of cancer research.
Location: Room 6 CF - Upper Level - Convention Center

Title: Unlocking Spatial Complexity: Harnessing Machine Learning for Spatial Biology Insights
